DataElement.preferredName: Symptom Distress Scale Insomnia Score 5 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Person's stated observation of the degree of distress they experience related to their insomnia, using a five-point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A patient reported questionnaire composed of rating scales developed to measure the degree of distress experienced by the patient for specific symptoms._A question about an individual's sleep quality._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A patient reported questionnaire composed of rating scales developed to measure the degree of distress experienced by the patient for specific symptoms.

Concepts.definition: A patient reported questionnaire composed of rating scales developed to measure the degree of distress experienced by the patient for specific symptoms.

Property.preferredDefinition: A question about an individual's sleep quality.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: A question about an individual's sleep quality.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

ValueDomain.preferredName: Symptom Distress Scale Insomnia Score 5 Point Scale
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Numeric scores from 1 (I sleep as well as I always have) to 5 (It is almost impossible for me to get a decent night's sleep) on a Likert scale used on the Symptom Distress Scale questionnaire.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: I frequently have trouble getting to sleep

ValueMeaning.preferredName: I frequently have trouble getting to sleep
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual frequently has or had trouble getting to sleep.

Concepts.longName: Frequently Have Trouble Getting to Sleep
Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual frequently has or had trouble getting to sleep.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: It is almost impossible for me to get a decent night's sleep

ValueMeaning.preferredName: It is almost impossible for me to get a decent night's sleep
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that it is or was almost impossible for an individual to get a decent night's sleep.

Concepts.longName: Almost Impossible to Get a Decent Night's Sleep
Concepts.definition: A response indicating that it is or was almost impossible for an individual to get a decent night's sleep.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: I have difficulty getting to sleep and staying asleep almost every night

ValueMeaning.preferredName: I have difficulty getting to sleep and staying asleep almost every night
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual has or had difficulty getting to sleep and staying asleep almost every night.

Concepts.longName: Have Difficulty Getting to Sleep and Staying Asleep
Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual has or had difficulty getting to sleep and staying asleep almost every night.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: I occasionally have trouble getting to sleep and staying asleep

ValueMeaning.preferredName: I occasionally have trouble getting to sleep and staying asleep
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual occasionally has or had trouble getting to sleep and staying asleep.

Concepts.longName: Occasionally Have Trouble Getting to Sleep and Staying Asleep
Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual occasionally has or had trouble getting to sleep and staying asleep.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: I sleep as well as I always have

ValueMeaning.preferredName: I sleep as well as I always have
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual sleeps or slept as well as they always have.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual sleeps or slept as well as they always have.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

Concepts.definition: An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Using PRO/HRQoL Measures
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is part of a full set of items that comprise a PRO/HRQoL measure. The full set must be used without any changes to the questions or value set in order to retain the validity and reliability associated with the measure.  The URL citation is provided so that caDSR users can obtain materials related to instructions for administering and/or scoring the measure. Changes may not be made to these documents.  Where an investigator wants to use single Patient Reported Outcome items that are integrated into a study, DCP review is required prior to inclusion of the item on a case report form.

ReferenceDocuments.name: SDS User's Manual
ReferenceDocuments.description: Documentation of the development, method of administration,  scoring procedures and psychometric properties of the SDS.
